subject: Personal Finance
title: Your Brain Hates Saving
description: A micro-lesson that makes Your Brain Hates Saving usable.

hook.text: Saving means giving up something now for something later. Your brain sees that as a loss.

buildup.text: The limbic system wants rewards now. The prefrontal cortex plans ahead. They're in constant conflict.

discovery.text: Brain scans show that imagining your future self activates the same regions as thinking about a stranger.

twist.text: We literally treat our future selves like other people â€” and we're not great at helping strangers.

climax.text: Making your future self feel real â€” through photos or visualizations â€” increases saving rates.

punchline.text: Your future self is a stranger to your brain.

quiz.question: How does the brain perceive your future self?
options: As if it were a different person entirely
As a more responsible version of you
As identical to your current self
